main.name: Kunlin Cai
main.bio: I am a student currently in Computer Science BA/MS program at Boston University. I am interested in studies and researches about privacy preserving calculations, multi-party computations and apply cryptos.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description3: Machine Learning, Universal Natural Language Processing, Database, Computer Network, Distributed System, Operating Systems, Algorithm, Concepts of Programming Language. Cryptography, Network Security.

researchinterest.title: Research Interest:
researchinterest.description: - Security (Cybersecurity and System security), Privacy in Machine Learning, and Cryptography (Multi-party Computation and other cryptographic implementations).

researchinterest.title: Research Goal:
researchinterest.description: - Reduce data breaching problems and make data calculations safer and easier.
researchinterest.description2: - Create a data security technique and framework for companies and individuals to use their data safely without sacrificing convenience and functionality.

research.title: Undergrad Visiting Student Researcher(Remote)
research.description: - Analyzed the TLS handshake data provided by Cloudflare, looked for repeating nonces caused by bad Random Number Generators (RNGs), and categorized the behaviors of the connections with repeating nonces. (Supervised by Professor Nadia Heninger)
research.description2: - Utilized a stateful application-layer scanner (Zgrab) to launch full scans on all IPv4 TLS hosts to uncover hosts who repeatedly use pre-calculate Keyshare Values and are under the threat of Middlebox interceptions. (Supervised by Professor Nadia Heninger)

research.title: Undergrad Student Researcher
research.description: - Researched on NLP text classification and sentences generalization with insufficient and imbalance data by adding attention mechanism to LSTM models (Supervised by Professor Derry Wijaya)
research.description2: -  Utilized BERT (The state of the art language model for NLP) with focal loss and LSTM-CNN model to categorize Amazon reviews on foods and identify the insecure foods sold online (Supervised by Professor Derry Wijaya).

publication.description: - Adyasha Maharana, Kunlin Cai, Joseph Hellerstein, Yulin Hswen, Michael Munsell, Valentina Staneva, Miki Verma, Cynthia Vint, Derry Wijaya, Elaine O Nsoesie, Detecting reports of unsafe foods in consumer product reviews, JAMIA Open, Volume 2, Issue 3, October 2019, Pages 330 338, https://doi.org/10.1093/jamiaopen/ooz030

work.title: Front End Architecture and Testing Intern
work.description: - Built front end applications for cryptocurrency trading platforms to perform user key management.
work.description2: - Researched and tested for front end cross origin solutions to read and share the key for users saved in cookies.
work.description3: - Tested the tools for Bitcoin transactions built by the team.

work.title: Research Intern in Cloud Native Lab
work.description: - Researched and present on Multiparty-computation (MPC) and privacy techniques used in an open source Federal Learning project – FATE.
work.description2: - Dockerized and Deployed Kubeflow, federal Learning project -- FATE on Kubernetes.
work.description3: - Deployed other machine learning and model serving tools such as Tfserving, Mlflow, OnnxRuntime, and Seldon to work with docker-compose and on Kubernetes.
work.description4: - Developed model management tools with Docker with Docker-compose and on Kubernetes.

work.title: Cybersecurity Platform Department Intern
work.description: - Conducted marketing research and product design for the Security Operations Center(SOC) platform.
work.description2: - Researched on functions of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) products.
work.description3: - Filled and translated technique documents for security products like firewalls and network traffic management tools.

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: - Conducted marketing research for a gymnastics grading program using computer visions as a client’s agent.
work.description2: - Designed solutions using computer visions techniques and sensors to monitor temperature and damages of machines and communication equipment.

testimonials.text: Everything negative – pressure, challenges – is all an opportunity for me to rise.
Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become. Everything else is secondary.
